If I don’t SleepNobody Sleeps!!
The personal and primary psychological significanceof skin1. It is the sensory organ through which the developing infant first experience the world.  It defines the newborn's boundaries as he discovers his separateness from the mother and the pleasures of her touch.2. It signals danger in the form of pain to theinquisitive toddler exploring his environment.3. It is the human armor of the four and fiveyear old who admires super heroes andfears his own vulnerability.4.  It is the outer layer that the adolescentrecognizes as “me" in the mirror. The personal and primary psychological significanceof skin
The Skin:• It is suntanned, tattooed, scarred, and decorated.  • It is imbued with sexuality and intimacy.  • It heralds the onset of old age with telltale signs of wrinkling and discoloration.• Finally loses its color in death.The Skin:• The skin is an integral part of every step ofdevelopment.  • Acting in the cultural, interpersonal, and personal arenas, it is crucial to self-esteem and identity formation that an individual be comfortable in their skin.Häufiges Problem: gestörter Schlaf durch Juckreiz/Kratzen43Dr. med.
